intro: Hieracium atrihaegerstroemii, commonly known as the dark-hued hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually rough and hairy, with a dark green to almost black coloration. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies.
